name: The Enclave Hotel & Suites

reviews.text: wonderful location.... beautiful grounds... helpful staff
reviews.title: lovely grounds
Good budget hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from 14 nights (28 April-12 may) fantastic vacation. My party of 11 stayed in 4 different rooms, 3 in block 1 and 1 in block 3. The only complaint was my in-laws room located next to the communal wash room where other guest would use the facility's late at night (midnight) and keep them awake. This problem was reported and reception offered to move them. The rooms were all clean and kept tidy by the maids every 3rd day. The on site shop was handy, stocking all the essentials and the pizza hut was quick and tasty if you don't want to go out. As a guest traveling with virgin you are entitled to a complimentary cooked breakfast in a separate dining room from other visitors. The breakfast was hit and miss, somedays sausage or bacon others gravy and biscuits but always fresh fruit, ommelets and eggs. The pools and grounds were always clean and felt safe with regular guard patrols. The location is perfect with many restaurants and shops in walking distance, universal 5 and disney only 20 minutes drive away. Everybody in my party agreed, we would stay here again! If you want to stay in a place like the Hilton then save up and book there, if you want a clean, friendly convenient place this is it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 7 nights while we were visiting the parks. It's a decent base for the money, yes the rooms could do with updating and possibly bigger beds but for the amount of time we spent in the room it didn't bother us that much. It's in a great location for being able to walk out to restaurants and in a great location for getting to the parks.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: There is a shop onsite but we found it was cheaper to go to one of the other shops off the hotel. There is a TGI Friday's opposite the Enclave and also a shop that has a post office and currency exchange if you need to change any money.
reviews.title: Fab time in Florida
Location location location
reviews.text: My two children and I had a fabulous time staying at this hotel and visiting Universal Studios every day. The studio room was very comfortable with a lovely view over the pool and a very useful small kitchen. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The pool and Jacuzzi was lovely and the tennis court was good too. The hotel is a bus ride from Universal and the shuttle buses were organized and fun (complete with singing bus driver!). There are many restaurants nearby to chose from. The breakfast at the hotel were good. We would certainly visit this hotel again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of our USA holiday. In summary it was perfect for what we needed. Its in a fantastic location just off International Drive with numerous restaurants and bars within walking distance. The view from our room was ace, out over a big lake with Hogwarts castle at universal in the distance, this certainly made my wifes stay! The room itself was very large with a separate "living" area with a sofa. We also had a big balcony with sunbeds. They lay on free shuttles to universal , not sure about disney as we didn't go. Only disappointments were 1. the "free" breakfast, really just a token gesture of a cereal bar, piece of fruit and tiny carton of juice. Our advice would be dont bother "upgrading" to a hot breakfast here, walk down the road to the ponderosa where they have a HUGE all you can eat buffet for $3.99.
reviews.title: You could do a lot worse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. noisy air con , we switched it off at night to get a good sleep but could be an issue in high summer.
reviews.title: Enclave Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise we can't fault it, great value for money and i'm sure we'll be back at some point in the future
reviews.title: All we wanted and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the beginning of May and found them to be conveniently located. The room itself was a little dated but clean and tidy and staff are very helpful. The only downside was the grab and go breakfast which was very disappointing so either upgrade or eat somewhere else.
reviews.title: The Magic Continues

reviews.text: I would like to say hello to Enclave suites as I know that they read these reviews. My husband and I stayed for 7 nights in a studio room. It had free wi-fi, a dishwasher, microwave, shower and bath, fridge and air con. There were 3 pools and a pizza hut, shuttles to theme parks and one thing I didnt know is that they do a poolside BBQ on a saturday and 'dive-in' movie night on a friday. It was clean and there is a free grab and go breakfast and free coffee which i enjoyed at the pool in the mornings before it got too hot. The 2 outdoor pools have vending machines and jacuzzi's which was nice, just one small thing was the caribbean style music, i would have preferred a radio station or something a bit more up to date. The location of the hotel is excellent, ihop and chillis nearby and we walked to Universal Studios twice. We would recommend this hotel as its all you need as a good base...we noticed the other guests seemed to really like it too its a shame that there are such mixed reviews.
reviews.title: Could have been better
Disappointed
reviews.text: When arrived was allocated a very disappointing room went down to reception to tell them was told have to pay for room change. Next morning went to reception again as the sofa bed was unable to be used due to springs coming out of the mattress and room very dirty and cupboards falling apart duty manager suggested another room the same as one we were allocated when looked at it was cleaner but sofa bed was disgusting duty manager suggested another mattress on top of it which would of ment having sofa bed out at all times which is not good enough. Vera the duty manager told us we had to pay for an upgraded room if we were still not happy this is what we Ended up paying to upgrade which I don't think I should of had to do Hannah the other duty manager was very polite and helpful Breakfast staff were very nice and polite every morning. I do think they have an obligation to make sure the rooms are kept to a good standard by the owners. Very disappointing for the money I spent for my holiday.

Before we left for Orlando we read up on the reviews about the Enclave Suites and while we were apprehensive we decided to hope for the best and wait till we actually arrived to make our judgement. Needless to say it was an extremely pleasant surprise when we did arrive. The staff were so friendly and really made you feel welcome. Our room was on the 5th floor in Block 2 with a great view from the balcony over the lake towards Wet & Wild. The room we stayed had 2 bedrooms and it was so clean and included in the kitchen area a new dishwasher, a very large microwave and a four ring cooker as well as a large fridge freezer. It also included all the cooking utensils you could need, a coffee machine and plenty of storage space. The 2 outdoor pools were always kept really clean and on Fridays they show a poolside movie at pool 1 as well as a barbeque on a Saturday which is great for the kids. We have been to Orlando five times and I have to say that without doubt this was the best place we have stayed in to date. We will definitely be requesting the Enclave Suites the next time we go. If you are staying in The Enclave keep an open mind because like us i'm sure you will be very pleasantly surprised and will enjoy your stay there. Thank you to all the staff that made us feel so welcome. We will be back.
reviews.title: Brilliant Experience

reviews.text: This was our 1st time at the Enclave Suites and we have had the best time ever, hotel staff really friendly and helpful we emailed the manager Melissa prior to our arrival and she exceeded our expectations we stayed on a bed and breakfast basis but after reading reviews were expecting the grab and go option so was pleastly surprised, The suite had everything we needed it was a great location just off International Drive, Hotel amenities great after long days at the Disney Parks, nice pool the kids loved the Friday Night Pool Movie nights with pizza, good alternative to getting ready to go out after a full on day in Disney! BBQ around the pool too Saturday afternoon. We opted for a late checkout very cheap. Overall we all had the best holiday ever we cant wait to come back and guarantee we will be staying here again. Highly Recommended!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel, Best Location, Best Staff - Excellent

reviews.text: Samantha Elliott.
reviews.title: Cannot recommend highly enough

reviews.text: I had read the reviews on here and was a little apprehensive about what to expect. We needn't have worried. From the minute we checked in, the staff were friendly and eager to do everything they could to ensure that our stay would be a pleasant one. We were delighted to find that our room on the 5th floor was light, modern, with fantastic amenities (including TV's in all the rooms and a fully equipped kitched) and furniture and had a lovely view of the pool (we could even see parts of 'Wishes' at Disney from our balcony and also the 9pm fireworks at Universal). I could quite happily have moved in permanently!
reviews.title: Honest Hotel

reviews.text: I was a little scared about going back ... but was I pleasantly surprised... staff were extremely friendly and helpful... room was very nice... large terrace.. beautiful view... I was shocked to see new washer and dryers... front load....until they have added the buffet breakfast into the amenities it is worth paying the extra for it...Tip...if you don`t have small children, go to the farthest pool at bldg 1...we didn`t need to rent a car since the location was close to restaurants and shopping plus they have shuttles (except to Disney) plus the trolly takes you anywhere on I-drive.....looking forward to going back next year
reviews.title: Better than last year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Enclave Suites in September 2011. This is the worse hotel we have ever stayed in. The suites comprise of 3 blocks and we were allocated a room in Block 3. Unfortunately we had to have our room changed 3 times as the first room we were given was really bad, it was really run down, there were stains on mattress along with a very bad smell. The second room we were allocated was a bit better although the door was lying open on arriving to look at the room. Finally we were given a room higher up in the block which was a big improvement, however it was still not great. I think that the suites are owned by members of the public so it depends what room you get, you may be lucky and get a room that is okay. I also think that Block One is the best so try and ask for a room there if you can if you are staying here.
reviews.title: Would Not Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is handy for everywhere you need to go in Orlando, however it is not on the nicest end of International Drive, I would stay on the other side. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone to stay for their trip to Orlando.
reviews.title: Not fantastic

reviews.text: Do hire a car whilst you on there as it is so handy to get everywhere and the petrol is really cheap. Everything is great in Orlando but I would definitely recommend Discovery Cove, Gatorland, Airboat Ride (Boggy Creek), Seaworld, Universal Studios.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: We have previously stayed here before and it was above average, but this time was just horrid. The hall way always smelt damp and of cigerettes which was quite off puttting.
reviews.title: Good and bad

description: Spacious two bedroom/two bath and deluxe studio suites with fully equipped kitchens and private balconies. Located just off International Drive and 5 minutes to Universal Studios. Two outdoor, one indoor heated pool & spa. Free continental breakfast and transport to major parks.
